'body': 'Our [`google_sign_in`](https://pub.dev/packages/google_sign_in) plugin is using an old "GSI v2" API that is being deprecated.

The new API library is the "Google Identity Services" API:
 - [ ] Web - https://developers.google.com/identity/gsi/web
 - [x] ~Android - https://developers.google.com/identity/one-tap/android~

(on iOS, it appears the existing library may still be the recommended API)', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/flutter/flutter/issues/101004/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, Android and iOS native apps should continue using their respective SDKs.

Not mentioned in the above resources is the deprecation of the gapi.auth2 module found in the [Google API Client Library for JavaScript](https://github.com/google/google-api-javascript-client). This module is shared with Google Sign-in platform.js library. The deprecation affects both. It is very likely you've reviewed the developer migration guides already, but for completeness: for user [sign-in](https://developers.google.com/identity/gsi/web/guides/migration) and for [authorization](https://developers.google.com/identity/oauth2/web/guides/migration-to-gis#overview ).
